segment.source: Add and Remove Language Packs on a Running Windows Installation
segment.target: Add and Remove Language Packs on a Running Windows Installation

segment.source: Add and Remove Language Packs on a Running Windows Installation
segment.target: Add and Remove Language Packs on a Running Windows Installation

segment.source: Add and Remove Language Packs on a Running Windows Installation
segment.target: Add and Remove Language Packs on a Running Windows Installation

segment.source: You can add support for additional languages on a running operating system, or to an offline image.
segment.target: You can add support for additional languages on a running operating system, or to an offline image.

segment.source: For information about how to install languages to an offline image, see Add and Remove Language Packs Offline Using DISM.
segment.target: For information about how to install languages to an offline image, see Add and Remove Language Packs Offline Using DISM.

segment.source: For information about installing Language Interface Packs (LIPs), see Add Language Interface Packs to Windows.
segment.target: For information about installing Language Interface Packs (LIPs), see Add Language Interface Packs to Windows.

segment.source: In Windows 10, users can install more languages and features by going to SettingsTime & languageRegion & languageAdd a language.
segment.target: In Windows 10, users can install more languages and features by going to SettingsTime & languageRegion & languageAdd a language.

segment.source: Add a Language Pack Online
segment.target: Add a Language Pack Online

segment.source: When you add language packs using DISM, the licensing requirements of how many language packs are allowed to run on the Windows edition are not verified.
segment.target: When you add language packs using DISM, the licensing requirements of how many language packs are allowed to run on the Windows edition are not verified.

segment.source: If you add multiple language packs, all non-default, non-user selected languages will be removed from the computer after a period of time.
segment.target: If you add multiple language packs, all non-default, non-user selected languages will be removed from the computer after a period of time.

segment.source: For more information, see Add Language Packs to Windows.
segment.target: For more information, see Add Language Packs to Windows.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: You can also add language packs to Windows Preinstallation and Windows Recovery installations.
segment.target: You can also add language packs to Windows Preinstallation and Windows Recovery installations.

segment.source: For more information, see WinPE: Mount and Customize and Customize Windows RE.
segment.target: For more information, see WinPE: Mount and Customize and Customize Windows RE.

segment.source: To add a language pack by using DISM
segment.target: To add a language pack by using DISM

segment.source: On the running operating system, open an elevated command-line prompt.
segment.target: On the running operating system, open an elevated command-line prompt.

segment.source: Type the following command to add a language pack to the operating system.
segment.target: Type the following command to add a language pack to the operating system.

segment.source: For more information about DISM international servicing commands, see DISM Languages and International Servicing Command-Line Options
segment.target: For more information about DISM international servicing commands, see DISM Languages and International Servicing Command-Line Options
